directive.name: The Rule of 3 (Fractal Sharding)
directive.rule: FILE SHARDING: Every directory MUST shard its contents after 3 files into a versioned subdirectory (e.g., `v1_files/`).
FOLDER SHARDING: Every parent directory MUST shard its subdirectories after 3 folders into a versioned meta-folder (e.g., `cluster_v1/`).
RECURSION: This rule is recursive, creating an infinite fractal tree of organized project memory.

directive.name: Tree Map Spawning
directive.rule: Every directory in the fractal tree MUST contain a local `TREE_MAP.md` or `INDEX.md` at its root.
The Tree Map MUST be spawned immediately upon the creation of the first shard or meta-folder.
The Tree Map MUST link to all children (files or sub-shards) and provide a 1-sentence summary of their contents to enable high-speed AI navigation.

directive.name: Scope of Application & Boundaries
directive.rule: DEV-ONLY MANDATE: Fractal Sharding and Tree Map Spawning apply STRICTLY to the `dev-work/` directory and its sub-branches.
PROJECT STERILITY: The `project/` directory MUST remain un-sharded and free of AI scaffolding (TreeView maps, versioned clusters, etc.) unless explicitly requested for massive codebases.
USER HANDOFF: The `project/` directory is the final product. It must follow standard industry naming and folder conventions for professional handoff.
